Mosaic

Why another grid system?

Two reasons: Simple vertical alignment is pretty useful in a grid and no other framework allows for mixed fixed/fluid columns in the same rows. The initial concept spawned from The Media Object and the grid grew out of necessity because the cells needed fixed width to be vertically centered.

Basic fluid, three column layout

Start out with a <div class="mosaic-row"></div> and nest three children with class="cell cell-4". The grid system is based on the classes .cell-# values, but you don't have to use the built-in grid. However, a width needs to be set on .cell elements.

Last

Reverse row direction

To reverse a row, simply add class="reverse" to a .mosaic-row

Alignment Examples

Cells can be horizontally aligned by adding .left, center, or right on to a .mosaic-row

Cells can be vertically aligned by adding .top, .middle, or .bottom to the .cell. The horizontal alignment classes can also be applied to cells.
